title: Jarren Duran’s hot start to spring training continues, hitting 2 homers vs. Twins. What could it mean for Red Sox’ lineup?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jarren Duran hit two home runs in a Red Sox spring training game against the Twins, continuing a strong start.
Duran's current spring performance includes hitting three home runs and achieving a .583 batting average.
Despite prior struggles against left-handed pitchers, Duran's recent success may alter his role in the Red Sox lineup.

title: As 2025-26 Bruins exceed expectations, so has their prospect pool in college hockey
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Bruins prospects James Hagens and Dean Letourneau have scored a combined 39 goals at Boston College this season.
Seven Bruins-drafted players participated in the BC-BU game, with Letourneau scoring BC's lone goal in a 3-1 loss.
The Bruins' prospect pool, including Hagens and Letourneau, shows promise with potential to impact Boston's NHL roster soon.

title: Celtics ‘clear pick’ to win the East? One NBA assistant coach reportedly feels that way
author: Conor Roche
bullets: An unnamed NBA assistant coach predicts the Boston Celtics to win the Eastern Conference despite trailing the Detroit Pistons.
The Celtics have been strong since Thanksgiving with a 29-11 record and a league-leading 9.9 net rating.
Cade Cunningham leads Pistons' offense, while Celtics boast multiple creators including Jaylen Brown and potential return of Jayson Tatum.

title: Review and setlist: Jason Isbell and the 400 Unit bring a well-rounded Americana showcase to Boston
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Jason Isbell and the 400 Unit performed at the Boch Center Wang Theatre in Boston on February 27, 2026.
The setlist included a mix of Isbell's solo and band work, plus covers from Drive-By Truckers and The Rolling Stones.
Songs performed addressed themes like Southern disillusionment and sobriety, featuring both acoustic and electric elements.

title: Latest reports suggest Patriots are unlikely to land big-name edge rusher before NFL Draft
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots likely unable to acquire top edge rushers like Trey Hendrickson and Jaelan Phillips due to high market prices.
Maxx Crosby's potential move is uncertain as Raiders reportedly demand two first-round picks for the Pro Bowler.
Patriots may target Missouri's Zion Young in draft, known for 52 pressures and 6.5 sacks last season.

title: What Paramount’s pending purchase of Warner Bros. Discovery means for sports fans
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Paramount Skydance sets to buy Warner Bros. Discovery for $110 billion, affecting sports broadcasting landscape.
CBS and TNT/TBS integration could boost exposure of MLB, NHL, and NCAA broadcasts under the new deal.
NFL may renegotiate streaming rights, with Netflix potentially targeting CBS's NFL package in upcoming deals.

title: Patriots reportedly interested in A.J. Brown, but not at Eagles’ current asking price
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The New England Patriots are interested in trading for Eagles' wide receiver A.J. Brown but find the asking price too high.
Philadelphia's potential trade of A.J. Brown could incur $44 million in dead money if done before June 1.
To accommodate Brown, the Patriots might ask Stefon Diggs to restructure his contract, which carries a $26.5 million cap hit.

title: Bye-bye transponders: E-ZPass switching to stickers
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Massachusetts is transitioning from plastic E-ZPass transponders to RFID technology stickers starting Sunday.
New E-ZPass sticker tags are free for drivers, reducing replacement costs previously at $20.
Switch to sticker tags is expected to save the state $7.4 million annually through lower production costs.

title: Woburn man charged with evading $1.2 million in income tax
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Jean Brito, 47, charged with evading over $1.2 million in taxes, pleads not guilty in Middlesex Superior Court.
Brito allegedly underreported over $20 million in business income between 2018 and 2023, prosecutors claim.
State Police and FBI searches uncovered $35,000 in cash and documents related to Boston Quality Cleaning Services.

title: Beware the birds: Bird flu confirmed in Boston
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Bird flu confirmed in Boston's Emerald Necklace park system; public health advisory issued.
Boston Public Health Commission advises avoiding wildlife contact; public risk deemed low.
CDC reports 71 human bird flu cases since February 2024, including 2 deaths.
